title: MPT
description: MPT flashcards for bar exam prep

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A test that assesses a student's ability to perform legal tasks based on provided materials.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Reading comprehension, organization, tone, communication, and ability to follow directions.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 003. Purpose of the MPT
cards.backPlain: To address only the required information within a 90-minute time frame.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 004. MPT Method Step 1
cards.backPlain: Read the Instruction Sheet in 1 minute.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Usually in the State of Columbia or Olympia, often in the 15th Federal Circuit.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Allowed in the MPT.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 007. MPT Method Step 2
cards.backPlain: Read the Task Memo in 4 minutes.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 008. Point of view
cards.backPlain: Can be objective or persuasive.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Can be a lay person or a legal professional.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 010. MPT Method Step 3
cards.backPlain: Read the Library in 20 minutes.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Start with statutes if given; the cases will illuminate.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Verify whether it is mandatory or persuasive authority.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 013. MPT Method Step 4
cards.backPlain: Develop a Working Outline in 10 minutes.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 014. Gray areas of the law
cards.backPlain: Identify and analyze them during the outline development.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Used to develop tests and subtests in the analysis.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 016. MPT Method Step 5
cards.backPlain: Read the File in 10 minutes.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Focus on finding facts that prove the elements or factors in your outline.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 018. Characterize legal relationships
cards.backPlain: Important for understanding the context of the facts.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 019. MPT Method Step 6
cards.backPlain: Write in 45 minutes.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Be responsive to the assigned task's tone.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 021. Types of Analyses
cards.backPlain: Various analyses that may include legal, persuasive, or objective writing.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: An outline that prioritizes facts and organizes them according to the elements they prove.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 023. Develop an attack outline
cards.backPlain: Decide the order and choose facts to prioritize.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Be aware of the broad range of potential tasks, such as writing a pleading or client letter.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Often a legal analysis is presented in IRAC or CRAC form.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Often a persuasive lay scenario, sometimes an opening argument or closing argument to a jury.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Looking for the ultimate fact to prove each element.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Often a letter to a client, acting as a counselor (giving advice to a lay person).

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Often a conflict-of-interest scenario, never ignore ethical considerations.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Adopt the correct tone and format.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Ask, 'why is this case here?'

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Throwing everything on paper; to fix, work on your outline.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Does not respond to the question; to fix, spend more time with the Task Memo.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Not paying attention to objective versus persuasive; to fix, focus on persuasive reasoning.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Goes outside the materials; to fix, practice MPTs outside your comfort zone.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Turns the MPT into a long, fact-intensive story; to fix, focus on giving a rule.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Ignores the facts; to fix, focus on linking an element to a fact.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Tends to do worse on one type of MPT; to fix, practice MPTs outside your comfort zone.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Compare your outline to the model answer.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Use the 'persuasive headings' approach.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Think in terms of client's goals and explain their options.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Keep factual summaries brief.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Grammar matters—write in a lawyerlike manner.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Format matters: Memo—To, From, RE:; Opening/Closing—'Ladies and Gentlemen of the Jury...'; Letter—address, date, salutation at the end.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Practice with time constraints—consider completing just the first 45 minutes of the MPT.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Spend more time on 'weaker' elements.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 047. Body of the Argument
cards.backPlain: Draft only the body of the argument.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Rules governing the behavior and ethics of legal professionals.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 049. Rules of Evidence
cards.backPlain: Legal principles that govern the admissibility of evidence in court.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Obligation to preserve client secrets and avoid disclosure.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 051. Franklin Rules of Professional Conduct—Rule 001.6
cards.backPlain: Shall not reveal info regarding representation.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: One of the exceptions allowing disclosure of client information.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 053. Disclosure Impliedly Authorized
cards.backPlain: Another exception permitting the revelation of client information.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 054. Substantial Injury Exception
cards.backPlain: Information may be revealed to prevent, mitigate, or rectify substantial injury to another's financial interests or property.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 055. Franklin Rules of Evidence—Rule 513
cards.backPlain: Defines elements of communication as confidential and for the purpose of facilitating legal services.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 056. Furtherance of Crime/Fraud
cards.backPlain: Exception to confidentiality if services were sought to enable or aid known crime/fraud.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Communications are assumed to be protected unless proven otherwise.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 058. Preponderance of the Evidence (POE)
cards.backPlain: Opposing party has the burden of proof by a greater weight of the evidence.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A reasonable basis for believing that a crime may have been committed.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 060. U.S. v. Robb
cards.backPlain: Case discussing the privilege of communication and exceptions for crime/fraud.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 061. State v. Sawyer
cards.backPlain: Case emphasizing the need for strong factual basis for crime/fraud to breach confidentiality.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Structured format for presenting legal arguments and facts.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: The principle of not revealing client information.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A fabricated excuse to avoid legal consequences.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 065. Communications Concerned Representation
cards.backPlain: Refers to discussions and information related to the legal representation of a client.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 066. Three Exceptions to Confidentiality
cards.backPlain: 1. Informed consent; Implied disclosure; Paragraph 1.0.2 regarding substantial injury.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 067. Franklin Rules of Evidence
cards.backPlain: Elements: 1) Confidential 2) Communication 3) Purpose of facilitating 4) Legal services

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: If sought or obtained to enable or aid what the client knew or reasonably should have known is a crime/fraud

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Opposing party has BOP by POE; If opposing party offers sufficient evidence to raise a substantial question (probable cause OR some evidence, unclear in Franklin), must be disclosed to the court

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 070. Proof of crime
cards.backPlain: Insured a building that burned down due to 'suspicious' origin; inquired into filing insurance claim; bank loan turned down before fire; failed alibi

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Building of another

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Requires intent to defraud

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 073. Policy of privilege
cards.backPlain: Oldest privilege; full and frank communication; only when necessary

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 074. Counter to privilege
cards.backPlain: Lift veil of secrecy when purpose is to facilitate crime/fraud

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Need to be protected, as he was seeking attorney's advice as potential target of criminal investigation

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 076. Inferences as to no crime/fraud
cards.backPlain: Equally strong; may have retained due to fear of prosecution—inform choices of client

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 077. Retained due to fear
cards.backPlain: Analogous: Retained due to fear of arson charges

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: Don't need to retain an attorney to commit this type of fraud, as merely need to file insurance paperwork

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 079. FRE does not support
cards.backPlain: Overview of law; presumed privileged; meets elements

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 080. Probable cause standard
cards.backPlain: Adopt probable cause standard (meets policy; similar to Sawyer)

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 081. Burden of proof
cards.backPlain: Even under 'some evidence' standard, prosecutor cannot meet burden (distinguishable from Robb)

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 082. Phoenix Corporation v. Biogenesis, Inc.
cards.backPlain: A case referenced in the chapter that requires completion of the Multistate Performance Test (MPT) before proceeding.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 083. Rule 004.4 of FPC
cards.backPlain: A rule adopted in 2002 that requires attorneys to notify the sender if they receive a document inadvertently.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: The unintentional release of privileged information that requires specific handling under legal ethics.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 085. Indigo v. Luna Motors
cards.backPlain: A case that established the necessity for attorneys to refrain from examining inadvertently sent privileged documents.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: The removal of an attorney from a case due to ethical violations or conflicts of interest.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A case that emphasizes the public trust in justice and integrity as a concern for disqualification.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A situation where the harm caused by a violation is so severe that it cannot be remedied.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 089. Six Factors for Disqualification
cards.backPlain: Knowledge of privilege, promptness of notice, extent of review, significance/curing prejudice, opposing party's fault, and opposing party prejudice via disqualification.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A legal privilege that keeps communications between an attorney and their client confidential.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 091. Legal Outline with Facts
cards.backPlain: A structured summary that includes the objective and legal considerations in a case.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A document outlining the legal objectives and considerations without including a statement of facts.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 093. Comment 1 on Indigo
cards.backPlain: Response to Indigo must be prompt and inadvertent; attorney-client privilege is irrelevant.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 094. Comment 2 on Indigo
cards.backPlain: Indigo was NOT adopted; attorneys must just notify.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 095. Mead v. Conley Machinery Co.
cards.backPlain: A case that discusses the limits of attorney-client privilege and the conditions under which disqualification can occur.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 096. Public Trust in Justice
cards.backPlain: The ethical standard that ensures the integrity of the legal system and the trust of the public.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 097. Extent of Review
cards.backPlain: The degree to which an attorney examines a document before determining how to proceed.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 098. Opposing Party's Fault
cards.backPlain: The responsibility of the opposing party in the context of disqualification and ethical violations.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 099. Opposing Party Prejudice via Disqualification
cards.backPlain: The negative impact on the opposing party resulting from the disqualification of their attorney.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 100. Policy of AttorneyClient Privilege
cards.backPlain: Encourages fully developed cases by ensuring confidentiality in attorney-client communications.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 101. Footnote 1 in Mead
cards.backPlain: States that incurable prejudice is neither necessary nor sufficient for disqualification.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 102. High Prejudice for Opposing Party
cards.backPlain: The significant disadvantage faced by the opposing party when losing an attorney who has developed a trial strategy.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A document sent without the intention of disclosure, which the recipient must notify the sender about if they know it was sent inadvertently.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A case where the disclosure of a document is authorized, distinguishing it from inadvertent disclosure cases.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A breach of professional conduct that may not be dispositive in disqualification but must still be addressed.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 106. Application in Mead
cards.backPlain: In Mead, it was determined that there was no prejudice, harm from counsel's knowledge was speculative, and high prejudice for the opposing party to lose counsel who developed trial strategy.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A structured outline used to present arguments, including conceding protection, addressing ethical violations, and discussing disqualification.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 108. Concede it is protected
cards.backPlain: The first step in the memo format, acknowledging that the document in question is protected.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 109. No Ethical Violation
cards.backPlain: The second step in the memo format, arguing that there was no ethical violation under the rule.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: A point made in the memo format stating that Indigo is distinguishable and that Rule 4.4 did not adopt it.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 111. Followed Mead's Mandates
cards.backPlain: A claim in the memo format that the actions taken adhered to the mandates of the Mead case.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 112. Two Factors Outweigh Four
cards.backPlain: The conclusion in the memo format asserting that the two factors in favor of the argument outweigh the four against it.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: The requirement for an attorney to notify the sender promptly upon receiving an inadvertently sent document.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.backPlain: The importance of the information received and whether any potential prejudice can be remedied.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 115. Opposing Party's Fault
cards.backPlain: The degree of responsibility the opposing party has in the situation leading to disqualification.

cards.subject: MPT
cards.rawHeader: MPT On Bar 116. Opposing Party Prejudice
cards.backPlain: The potential harm that the opposing party may suffer as a result of disqualification.
